title: Maintain a Neutral, Professional Tone
description: Use an objective and professional voice in technical writing. Avoid personal opinions, slang, or overly casual language unless specified by the brand voice guidelines.

examples.incorrect: I think this feature is super cool and easy to use!
examples.correct: This feature simplifies the process for the user.

title: Avoid Humor or Sarcasm
description: Humor, sarcasm, or irony can be misunderstood and should be avoided in technical content.

examples.incorrect: If you mess this up, youâ€™ll be in big trouble!
examples.correct: Incorrect configuration can cause system errors.

title: Be Encouraging, Not Commanding
description: Use polite, instructive language instead of authoritarian commands. This keeps the tone user-friendly.

examples.incorrect: You must click the Submit button now.
examples.correct: Click the Submit button to complete the process.

title: Use Second Person for Direct Instructions
description: When giving instructions, address the reader as 'you'. This makes the content more direct and clear.

examples.incorrect: The user should click the Submit button.

title: Avoid Marketing Language in Technical Documentation
description: Focus on facts, features, and instructions. Avoid promotional phrases unless the content is explicitly for marketing.

examples.incorrect: This groundbreaking feature will change your life!
examples.correct: This feature automates the backup process.

title: Be Inclusive and Respectful
description: Avoid language that could be interpreted as biased, exclusionary, or disrespectful.

examples.incorrect: Ask the guys in the IT department for help.
examples.correct: Contact the IT department for assistance.
